location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions:155 x 205 mmFormat:1 b&w silver gelatin printCondition:The image is in good condition with minimal fading.Process:Gelatin silver print

mods.abstract: Genre/Subject Matter:This aerial view of the Beni Bu Hassan looking south on 4 February 1932 by the R.A.F. during a reconnaissance mission in advance of a planned bombardment of Aiqa and Jaalan (Ja‘alān) described in following folios, f. 129-130.The settlement is at centre and left, and consists of a large number of indistinct walled enclosures surrounded by plantations.The inscriptions in the upper right corner probably refer to camera settings, as well as date and time of capture.Inscriptions:Recto, directly into negative, upper right corner: 203.B.348.P BENI-BU-HASSAN LOOKING S. 4.2.32.1030 F10" 2000'’Temporal Context:Prints produced on 18 February 1932. Photographs taken on 4 February 1932, likely at 10.30 am.
